This petition under Article 32 of the Constitution challenges the constitutionality of the Uttar Pradesh Consolidation of Holdings Act,  U.P. V of 1954 , as amended by U.P. Acts No. XXVI of 1954, No. XIII of 1955, No. XX of 1955, No. XXIV of 1956 and No. XVI of 1957,  hereinafter called the Act .

holdings.reasoning_summary: Small land taken (0.5-1%); direct benefits from common pool uses (pasture, manure pits etc.); plus overall consolidation advantages outweigh cash amount.

holdings.text: Therefore, assuming that Article 31(2) applies as it was before the Fourth Amendment, it cannot be said that the compensation which the tenure-holders will get under section 29-B is inadequate in the circumstances. This ground of attack also therefore fails.

anchor.surface_text: Therefore, assuming that Article 31 2  applies as it was before the Fourth Amendment, it cannot be said that the companypensation which the tenure-holders will get under section 29-B is inadequate in the circumstances. This ground of attack also therefore fails.
